new_generated_rule_explanation: The rule 'incorrect-default-value' checks all classes and their methods. If a method has the '@DefaultValue' annotation, it retrieves the default value and the type of the first argument of the method. It then asserts that the default value can be converted to the specified parameter type. If the conversion is not possible, it generates a message indicating the default value, the method name, the fully qualified name of the class, and the specified parameter type.
